nodes.title: Small area estimation
nodes.desc: A statistical technique used to estimate parameters for small geographic areas or subpopulations, often with limited sample sizes. [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_area_estimation)

nodes.title: Survey sampling
nodes.desc: A method of selecting a subset of individuals or households from a larger population to gather data, which is then used for small area estimation. [American Community Survey](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs)

nodes.title: Data integration
nodes.desc: The process of combining data from multiple sources to improve small area estimation. [Journal of Official Statistics](https://www.jos.nu)

nodes.title: Data quality
nodes.desc: The process of evaluating and improving the accuracy and reliability of data used in small area estimation. [Journal of Data Quality](https://www.journalofdataquality.com)

nodes.title: Small area estimation software
nodes.desc: Specialized software used to perform small area estimation, such as SAE, Small Area Estimation, or R packages like sae. [Software for Small Area Estimation](https://www.sae-software.com)

nodes.title: Applications of small area estimation
nodes.desc: Small area estimation is used in various fields, such as public health, education, and economics. [Journal of Applied Statistics](https://www.tandfonline.com/toc/cjas20/current)

nodes.title: Limitations of small area estimation
nodes.desc: Small area estimation can be limited by factors such as data quality, sample size, and model assumptions. [Journal of Survey Statistics and Methodology](https://academic.oup.com/jssam)

nodes.title: Future research directions
nodes.desc: Ongoing research in small area estimation focuses on improving methods, incorporating new data sources, and addressing limitations. [Journal of Official Statistics](https://www.jos.nu)

nodes.title: Census data
nodes.desc: A comprehensive dataset collected from a population, often used as a benchmark for small area estimation. [United States Census Bureau](https://www.census.gov)

nodes.title: Administrative records
nodes.desc: Data collected from government agencies, such as tax returns or social security records, which can be used to supplement survey data. [National Center for Education Statistics](https://nces.ed.gov)

nodes.title: Model-based estimation
nodes.desc: A statistical approach that uses models to estimate parameters for small areas, often incorporating auxiliary data. [Journal of Official Statistics](https://www.jos.nu)

nodes.title: Empirical Bayes estimation
nodes.desc: A method that combines survey data with prior information to produce estimates for small areas. [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empirical_Bayes_method)

nodes.title: Hierarchical Bayes estimation
nodes.desc: A Bayesian approach that models the variation in estimates across small areas using a hierarchical structure. [Journal of the American Statistical Association](https://www.tandfonline.com/toc/uasa20/current)

nodes.title: Spatial models
nodes.desc: Statistical models that account for the spatial relationships between small areas, often used in small area estimation. [Spatial Demography](https://www.spatialdemography.org)

nodes.title: Time series models
nodes.desc: Statistical models that account for the temporal relationships between small areas, often used in small area estimation. [Journal of Time Series Analysis](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/14679880)

nodes.title: Machine learning
nodes.desc: A set of techniques that can be used to improve small area estimation, such as neural networks or random forests. [Journal of Machine Learning Research](https://www.jmlr.org)
